TopicTitle: What can I do about a crooked rocket?

Articles.Content:
It happens every time I load a save with it focused or switch to it. I've checked the persistence, and the parts haven't changed their positions. Is there anything I can do to salvage this ship, or make sure this doesn't happen again? Could it be related to the inflatable parts from SSPR?

Any insight or help is appreciated.

Having the same problem, but with a space station, and it’s less severe for me.

Long things seem to be affected.

Don’t know why, but not a significant problem for me.

1 minute ago, TheKSPBeginner said:

Having the same problem, but with a space station, and it’s less severe for me.

Long things seem to be affected.

Don’t know why, but not a significant problem for me.

Unfortunately, I only found this problem when I switched to this craft to make its ejection burn for Moho...

Never mind, I've solved this problem thanks to Reddit. Apparently the bug is caused by timewarping an autostrutted ship and cancelling its rotation. Editing the persistence to turn off autostrut fixed it for me.

ah, good

Edited November 5, 2019 by TheKSPBeginner

Things that move around (such as inflating, but also things that bend or rotate) tend to have issues in KSP, always have. Infernal Robotics fought the problem for years and never won it to my knowledge. The KSP devs were able to get around it in a slight way with the Klaw (but it was still buggy to start with even with it's limited movement) and in much better form with the Breaking Ground expansion. But any mods that do it, I'd be very suspect of.
